page.title: 15CHANGING SCENE THIS CENTURY
page.content: Tyler Hill Village has maintained throughout the 20th.Century a resourceful rural community life. Peoples jobs in 1900 serviced the local community...blacksmith dairyman grocer laundry postoffice market gardener 2 public houses 3 farmers haulage-contractor hop workers & railway workers. About 1930 there was economic growth with a florist miller- baker timber merchant poultry farmer decorator and tea-room in addition to the 1900 trades. In 1960 cars and buses enabled people to look outward for work Trades dramatically declined. Only the PO/Shop pub. builders yard and farmers remained.In 1985 houses have increased and local jobs decreased. However, village life is flourishing, as can be seen on the next page.( 16)
